system.description:
When you acquire this Skill, choose a Species other than humanoid.

Once per Scene, you may create a Bond of inferiority or admiration with a creature of that Species, as long as you are aware of their presence or a sign of their passing. As long as you have this Bond, that creature is your Quarry. If you fail to form a Bond, your expertise has revealed that the Species is not present/involved.

You gain a bonus of 【SL】 to Checks you perform to locate, track, or Study your Quarry.

summary.value: Borders are a trick of the mind.

system.description:
ALSO: Adventurer, Explorer, Treasure Hunter

Nomads searching for a fabled continent, explorers braving the wilds, grizzled hunters and travelers have one thing in common: they are Wayfarers. While a majority of heroes travel the world during their adventures, Wayfarers live for the journey. They are always eager to visit new places and learn from others. In the eyes of a Wayfarer, the wilderness is neither foe nor an ally, but rather a stern teacher who can reveal many forgotten truths.

WAYFARER FREE BENEFITS
  • Permanently increase your maximum Inventory Points by 2.

WAYFARER SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.L34pOGhdH0ZwV4Bt]{Faithful Companion} (SL5)

Together with the rest of your group, design a level 5 beast, construct, elemental or plant creature (Core Rulebook, page 304) that becomes your companion. This creature has no Initiative score and does not level up, can have up to two basic attacks, gains a bonus equal to 【SL】 to Accuracy Checks and Magic Checks, and their maximum Hit Points are equal to【(SL multiplied by the companion’s base Might die size) + half your level】.

Your companion doesn’t get a turn during conflicts, but on your turn you can use an action to have the companion perform an action (only once per turn). If you leave a scene, your companion leaves with you.

If your companion falls to 0 Hit Points, they flee and rejoin you at the start of the next scene in which you are present, with HP equal to their Crisis score. When you rest, your companion also gains the full benefits of resting.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.0n8T7U81oNP7yU5X]{Resourceful} (SL4)

You recover 【SL】 Inventory Points after each travel roll (Core Rulebook, page 106).

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.CHMsojkTh3fU8HXg]{Tavern Talk} (SL3)

When you rest inside an inn or tavern, you may ask the Game Master up to 【SL】 questions about your surroundings and the people who live here; the Game Master will answer truthfully and you describe how you gathered the information.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.rsGhkElIiEBgN5zA]{Treasure Hunter} (SL2)

When your group journeys on the world map, you will make a discovery on a roll of 【SL + 1】 or lower on the travel roll (instead of only on a 1).

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.fuPzuDHzaKUgbvL2]{Well-Traveled}

You reduce the die rolled for your travel rolls by one size (to a minimum of d6).

If multiple characters have this Skill, the effects are not cumulative.

summary.value: Ah, I knew this was going to happen.

system.description:
ALSO: Archivist, Sage, Scholar

Loremasters are known for their insatiable curiosity and appetite for discovery. They firmly believe that knowledge equates to power, and would often trade all gold in the world for a chance at solving a good mystery. Unfortunately, a majority of Loremasters tend to be aloof and easily distracted, rarely concerning themselves with “pragmatic” matters… to the point of sometimes failing to realize the darker implications of their discoveries.

LOREMASTER FREE BENEFITS
  • Permanently increase your maximum Mind Points by 5.

LOREMASTER SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.J5KbrSiczxizbdM3]{Flash of Insight} (SL3)

When you roll a 13 or higher on a Check performed to investigate a creature, item or location — this includes using the Study action during a conflict — you may ask the Game Master up to 【SL】 questions concerning the subject of your investigation. You may ask these questions immediately or save them for later; whenever you ask one of these questions, the Game Master will answer truthfully and you will describe your character’s deductive process. This Skill may only be used once on the same creature, item or location.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.xaNu6plCZfo9dGsX]{Focused} (SL5)

Permanently increase your maximum Mind Points by 【SL × 3】.

When you perform an Open Check using 【INS + INS】, you gain a bonus equal to 【SL】 on that Check (this only applies to Open Checks).

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.XNAHXFdVPKiABegZ]{Knowledge Is Power}

When you perform an Accuracy Check, you may replace one of the Attribute dice with Insight (such as 【INS + INS】 for a pistol or 【INS + MIG】 for a waraxe).

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.YiBD86tGOvFSlaZ6]{Quick Assessment} (SL6)

At the start of a conflict, you may spend up to 【SL × 5】 Mind Points. For every 5 Mind Points you spend this way, choose one option: choose a creature you can see and the GM reveals one of their Traits; or name a damage type and choose a creature you can see, and the GM reveals that creature’s Affinity towards that damage type.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.NseNebtgAwSF7pM6]{Trained Memory}

You may perfectly recall the details of any scene you have visited within the past week. You can “go back in time” within your mind in order to examine and investigate such scenes again — your Flash of Insight Skill will apply to these memories as well.
Automatically equipped in each empty hand slot.
When you perform an Accuracy Check, you may replace one of the Attribute dice with Insight (such as 【INS + INS】 for a pistol or 【INS + MIG】 for a waraxe).

When you roll a 13 or higher on a Check performed to investigate a creature, item or location — this includes using the Study action during a conflict — you may ask the Game Master up to 【SL】 questions concerning the subject of your investigation. You may ask these questions immediately or save them for later; whenever you ask one of these questions, the Game Master will answer truthfully and you will describe your character's deductive process.

This Skill may only be used once on the same creature, item or location.

You reduce the die rolled for your travel rolls by one size (to a minimum of d6).

If multiple characters have this Skill, the effects are not cumulative.

summary.value: One creature suffers 10 damage of a type of your choice (10 Air, 10 Bolt, 10 Earth, 10 Fire, or 10 Ice).

system.description:
For 2 Inventory Points, one creature suffers 10 damage of a type of your choice (air, bolt, earth, fire, or ice).

  • Target Suffers: @DMG[10 air], @DMG[10 bolt], @DMG[10 earth], @DMG[10 fire], or @DMG[10 ice]

summary.value: This allows the entire group to rest in the wilderness and at sea.

system.description: For 4 Inventory Points, this allows the entire group to rest in the wilderness and at sea.
For 3 Inventory Points, one creature recovers @HEAL[50 hp].

summary.value: One creature recovers from a single status effect.

system.description: For 2 Inventory Points, one creature recovers from a single status effect.
For 3 Inventory Points, one creature recovers @HEAL[50 mp].

On your turn during a conflict scene, you may spend 10 Mind Points to perform the Study action for free, as long as your target is your Quarry. If you do, any other Checks you perform during that turn suffer a penalty of by 【3 - SL】. This Skill may only be used once on the same creature (and remember the normal restrictions on the Study action.)

summary.value: If hatred you will never find your quarry.

system.description:
ALSO: Inquisitor, Specialist, Tracker

The world is full of dangerous creatures and malevolent spirits that threaten common folk. Hunters have dedicated themselves to understanding such beings, developing an uncanny ability to track them down and then survive the encounter. Some remorselessly slay their targets, while others mediate, lead them from vulnerable communities, or quietly observe from afar.

Whether they seek Beasts to feed their villages, Elementals to study their mysterious properties, or Demons to protect time and space itself, the focus and expertise of Hunters keeps them one step ahead of their quarry is your guide.

HUNTER FREE BENEFITS

  • Permanently increase your maximum Inventory Points by 2.

  • Gain the ability to equip martial ranged weapons.

  • Mastering Hunter qualifies you for Powerful Shot (Core Rulebook page 238).

HUNTER SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.4ECytZQiA3WNMBW9]{Bloodhound} (SL4)

When you acquire this Skill, choose a Species other than humanoid.

Once per Scene, you may create a Bond of inferiority or admiration with a creature of that Species, as long as you are aware of their presence or a sign of their passing. As long as you have this Bond, that creature is your Quarry. If you fail to form a Bond, your expertise has revealed that the Species is not present/involved.

You gain a bonus of 【SL】 to Checks you perform to locate, track, or Study your Quarry.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.fTgS8KOEBCwEPtFJ]{Silencer} (SL4)

You may use an action and spend 10 Mind Points to perform an Opposed 【INS + WLP】 Check against your Quarry. If you succeed, they cannot spend Mind Points until your next turn. You get a bonus equal to 【SL】 to this Check.

If you have a weapon equipped, you may instead use its Accuracy formula, and your target opposes you with the same attributes (not benefitting from any bonuses in the formula).

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.tV6JyUmx3Ziykz9g]{Silver & Garlic}

When you spend Inventory Points to deal damage to a creature of the Species you chose for Bloodhound, inflict a status effect on them, or to recover from a status effect inflicted by them, spend 1 less Inventory Point (to a minimum of 1).

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.r3CzR7Yk1gKJthEv]{Target Insight} (SL3)

On your turn during a conflict scene, you may spend 10 Mind Points to perform the Study action for free, as long as your target is your Quarry. If you do, any other Checks you perform during that turn suffer a penalty of by 【3 - SL】. This Skill may only be used once on the same creature (and remember the normal restrictions on the Study action.)

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.ek3HmMmJLSxQ5L40]{Wise to Your Tricks} (SL5)

Whenever your Quarry casts a spell or uses a Skill that includes you as a target, you may have that creature lose 【SL × 2】Mind Points. If a Check associated with that creature’s Skill or spell fails, they lose 【SL × 3】Mind Points instead.

HUNTER NOTES
